snippet: The former Myanmar government - which did insult to the word government - was a ruthless military junta that ruled the country for nearly 50 years. Against that cynical backdrop, when The Lady, Aung San Suu Kyi, fell ill during a speech at a...
abstract: The former Myanmar government - which did insult to the word government - was a ruthless military junta that ruled the country for nearly 50 years. Against that cynical backdrop, when The Lady, Aung San Suu Kyi, fell ill during a speech at a pro-democracy rally on Saturday, people might have been forgiven the immediate suspicion that her political opponents or reactionary elements in the military had tampered with her food or water. The old regime was not above a poisoning.
